BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>What is the problem?</denchmark-h>
 
 I am trying to build/install ray from source, but ran into the following error:
 <denchmark-code>ERROR: Unrecognized option: --incompatible_depset_is_not_iterable=false
 </denchmark-code>
 
 It seems as if in the latest bazel version, they have removed that flag: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/9f9f5ec10fed81362c35c50eeb4515bbe5bf8bce>bazelbuild/bazel@9f9f5ec</denchmark-link>
 
 Ray version and other system information (Python version, TensorFlow version, OS):
 ray: 0.8.4
 python: 3.8.2
 os: Arch Linux
 bazel: 2.2.0
 <denchmark-h:h3>Reproduction (REQUIRED)</denchmark-h>
 
 Please provide a script that can be run to reproduce the issue. The script should have no external library dependencies (i.e., use fake or mock data / environments):
 If we cannot run your script, we cannot fix your issue.
 
  I have verified my script runs in a clean environment and reproduces the issue.
  I have verified the issue also occurs with the latest wheels.
 
 The above does not apply.

comments_0.comment_text: Ive been having this same issue every time I try to run the build. I have to delete that flag whenever I pull the latest code
